tasks.task: Designing a drift irrigation system for an orchard
Understand water sources and pressure regulation
subtasks: Identify water source (Canal Isabel II)
Use pressure regulator to manage high water pressure (>17 meters)
Use hydraulics valves and pressure reducers
Equip with filters (e.g., DICS filters) to prevent emitter clogging
Choose appropriate drippers (e.g., online emitters, intra-line emitters)
Calculate water requirements based on climatic factors
Determine optimal discharge rates for irrigation emitters
Design pipe diameters and layouts for primary and tertiary pipes
Installelectro valves and pressure reducers for automated control
Use pressure buttons and digital manometers for real-time pressure checks
Implement volume meters (water meters) for irrigation scheduling

tasks.task: Design and install a drift irrigation system for organic orchards
subtasks: Source water from Canal Isabel II
Regulate water pressure with regulators and pressure reducers
Install filters (e.g., DICS) to prevent emitter clogging
Select and configure drippers and emitters (e.g., online, intra-line models)
Calculate water requirements and discharge rates
Plan pipe diameters and layouts for primary and tertiary distribution
Install electro valves and pressure reducers
Monitor pressure using buttons and manometers
Utilize volume meters for irrigation scheduling
